text: Alincthun is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in the Hauts-de-France region of France. ==Geography== A small farming commune comprising 12 hamlets, some east of Boulogne, at the junction of the D238e2 and the D137 roads. The river Liane flows through the village. ==Population== ==Sights== * The church of St. Denis, dating from the seventeenth century. * The seventeenth-century Château du Fresnoy. * Three 17th-century manor houses at La Guilbauderie, Le Fay and Bois-du-Coq. * A water mill. ==See also== *Communes of the Pas-de- Calais department ==References== Category:Communes of Pas-de-Calais
title: Alincthun
